text: Sun Zhili (; born 1942) is a Chinese translator. He is among the first few in China who translated the works of Jane Austen's into Chinese language. His translations are well respected by domestic and overseas scholars. ==Biography== Sun was born in 1942 in China. He was a professor at the PLA College of Foreign Languages (now PLA Information Engineering University). He started to publish works in 1979, after the Cultural Revolution. ==Personal life== Sun married Tang Huixin (), who is also an English teacher. ==Translations== * * * * * ==References== Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:PLA Information Engineering University faculty Category:English–Chinese translators
